paragraphs: Hello, potential employer or stalker. My name is Josh Rogan (20), however you must have known that to get onto this webpage. I am currently attending the University of Scranton as a Computer Science major (Academic Junior). I have made the dean's list three times and have a near 4.0 in Computer Science courses. So far I have studied topics ranging from basic programming to data structures and machine language.

I currently work at the Technology Support Center on the Residential Network (ResNet) where I repair and tune-up laptops and perform other general tech support. I specialize in virus remediation: removing any types of malware, spyware, viruses, rootkits , etc. This job has given me a high degree of experience in virtually all areas of technical support.

I also work at the Center for Teaching and Learning Excellence as a Technical Consultant. There I assist professors and faculty with technical problems relating to technology in the classroom. I do a large amount of video editing using Camtasia, Adobe Premiere Pro CS6, and Helix Producer. We offer training to professors to use our learning management system (currently Angel). I am also the student representative on the committee appointed to decide what our next learning management system will be (Blackboard, Desire2Learn, or Canvas). We are responsible for creating and managing webpages for faculty and organizations. We meet bi-weekly to create professional development projects. These projects are how we communicate with the campus about forms of technology that are helpful in the classroom. We operate on a yearlong basis in both individual and group settings. Some examples of the topics we covered are iTunesU, Cloud Storage (SkyDrive, dropbox, Icloud etc.), screen sharing software (join.me), and upcoming operating systems such as Windows 8.

Please enjoy this site that I built from the ground up. I feel that it speaks for itself as an example of my web development capabilities. All data through the site are in JSON files, processed server side through PHP (available to JavaScript too), and displayed on the front end with HTML5/CSS3 helped withJQuery. Because everything is in JSON format, I am easily able to produce a printable resume on one page without duplicating any data. I chose the option of JSON instead of a database like SQL because the files don't lend themselves to a database; there just isn't enough data. I also used PHP's Mod-Rewrite to create links and directories through the site. Personally, my favorite aspect of the website is the quote generator that randomly picks one of my favorite quotes.
